content: Despite the importance of postoperative atrial fibrillation, the most effective management strategy for this common surgical complication remains uncertain, a factor that had led to a substantial variation in treatments. The joint guidelines of the American College of Cardiology, American Heart Association, and Heart Rhythm Society, which were published when our trial was far along in enrollment, recommend rate control with beta-blockers as the first-line therapy in patients whose condition is hemodynamically stable (i.e., class I, level of evidence A)
